body_html:
+1.
It'd be great to be able to sample from gamma distributions in TF. That would make it possible to sample from many other popular distributions, such as:

  • Inverse-Gamma (just the inverse of a gamma r.v.)
  • Beta/Dirichlet (which are just normalized gamma random vectors)
  • Student t (sample from a normal whose variance is sampled from an inverse-gamma)
  • Gumbel (location-scale transformation of a log-transformed inverse-gamma)

If the Poisson distribution were also implemented, that would add

  • Negative binomial (sample from a Poisson whose mean is sampled from a gamma)

It'd be great to be able to sample from gamma distributions in TF. That would make it possible to sample from many other popular distributions, such as:

- Beta/Dirichlet (which are just normalized gamma random vectors)
